Definition: A major scale mode starting on the first degree, with a bright and happy sound, scale degrees 1-2-3-4-5-6-7
A mode starting on the second degree of the major scale, with a minor third and flattened seventh, often jazzy or melancholic
A mode starting on the third degree, with a minor second and minor seventh, giving a Spanish or exotic feel
A mode starting on the fourth degree, with a raised fourth, creating a dreamy or ethereal sound
A mode starting on the fifth degree, with a major third and flattened seventh, often used in blues and rock
A natural minor scale mode starting on the sixth degree, with a sad or somber mood, scale degrees 1-2-b3-4-5-b6-b7
A mode starting on the seventh degree, with a diminished fifth and minor seventh, sounding dissonant and unstable
An interval where two notes are the same pitch, 0 semitones apart, e.g., C to C
An interval of one semitone, sounding tense or dissonant, e.g., C to C#
An interval of two semitones, sounding consonant, e.g., C to D
An interval of three semitones, with a minor quality, e.g., C to Eb
An interval of four semitones, with a major quality, e.g., C to E
An interval of five semitones, sounding open and consonant, e.g., C to F
An interval of six semitones, known as the 'diabolus in musica,' e.g., C to F#
An interval of seven semitones, highly consonant, e.g., C to G
An interval of eight semitones, with a minor quality, e.g., C to Ab
An interval of nine semitones, with a major quality, e.g., C to A
An interval of ten semitones, common in dominant chords, e.g., C to Bb
An interval of eleven semitones, bright and tense, e.g., C to B
An interval of twelve semitones, where the higher note is double the frequency of the lower, e.g., C to C
The Ionian mode in the key of C, starting on C, notes C-D-E-F-G-A-B, equivalent to C major
The Dorian mode in the key of C, starting on D, notes D-E-F-G-A-B-C, parent scale Bb major
The Phrygian mode in the key of C, starting on E, notes E-F-G-A-B-C-D, parent scale Ab major
The Lydian mode in the key of C, starting on F, notes F-G-A-B-C-D-E, parent scale G major
The Mixolydian mode in the key of C, starting on G, notes G-A-B-C-D-E-F, parent scale F major
The Aeolian mode in the key of C, starting on A, notes A-B-C-D-E-F-G, equivalent to A minor
The Locrian mode in the key of C, starting on B, notes B-C-D-E-F-G-A, parent scale Db major
The Ionian mode in the key of G, starting on G, notes G-A-B-C-D-E-F#, equivalent to G major
The Dorian mode in the key of G, starting on A, notes A-B-C-D-E-F#-G, parent scale F major
The Phrygian mode in the key of G, starting on B, notes B-C-D-E-F#-G-A, parent scale Eb major
The Lydian mode in the key of G, starting on C, notes C-D-E-F#-G-A-B, parent scale D major
The Mixolydian mode in the key of G, starting on D, notes D-E-F#-G-A-B-C, parent scale C major
The Aeolian mode in the key of G, starting on E, notes E-F#-G-A-B-C-D, equivalent to E minor
The Locrian mode in the key of G, starting on F#, notes F#-G-A-B-C-D-E, parent scale Ab major
The Ionian mode in the key of F, starting on F, notes F-G-A-Bb-C-D-E, equivalent to F major
The Dorian mode in the key of F, starting on G, notes G-A-Bb-C-D-E-F, parent scale Eb major
The Phrygian mode in the key of F, starting on A, notes A-Bb-C-D-E-F-G, parent scale Db major
The Lydian mode in the key of F, starting on Bb, notes Bb-C-D-E-F-G-A, parent scale C major
The Mixolydian mode in the key of F, starting on C, notes C-D-E-F-G-A-Bb, parent scale Bb major
The Aeolian mode in the key of F, starting on D, notes D-E-F-G-A-Bb-C, equivalent to D minor
The Locrian mode in the key of F, starting on E, notes E-F-G-A-Bb-C-D, parent scale Gb major
The Ionian mode in the key of D, starting on D, notes D-E-F#-G-A-B-C#, equivalent to D major
The Dorian mode in the key of D, starting on E, notes E-F#-G-A-B-C#-D, parent scale C major
The Phrygian mode in the key of D, starting on F#, notes F#-G-A-B-C#-D-E, parent scale Bb major
The Lydian mode in the key of D, starting on G, notes G-A-B-C#-D-E-F#, parent scale A major
The Mixolydian mode in the key of D, starting on A, notes A-B-C#-D-E-F#-G, parent scale G major
The Aeolian mode in the key of D, starting on B, notes B-C#-D-E-F#-G-A, equivalent to B minor
The Locrian mode in the key of D, starting on C#, notes C#-D-E-F#-G-A-B, parent scale Eb major
The Ionian mode in the key of A, starting on A, notes A-B-C#-D-E-F#-G#, equivalent to A major
The Dorian mode in the key of A, starting on B, notes B-C#-D-E-F#-G#-A, parent scale G major
The Phrygian mode in the key of A, starting on C#, notes C#-D-E-F#-G#-A-B, parent scale F major
The D Lydian mode in the key of A, starting on D, notes D-E-F#-G#-A-B-C#, parent scale E major
The Mixolydian mode in the key of A, starting on E, notes E-F#-G#-A-B-C#-D, parent scale D major
The Aeolian mode in the key of A, starting on F#, notes F#-G#-A-B-C#-D-E, equivalent to F# minor
The Locrian mode in the key of A, starting on G#, notes G#-A-B-C#-D-E-F#, parent scale Bb major
